Class Cyk

  • java.lang.Object
    • Cyk

  • public class Cyk
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the CYK Algorithm that uses a context-free grammar file and checks to see whether a given string is accepted by that grammar. Author: Akshay Hegde CS154 Section 1 Date: March 15, 2013

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FILE_ERROR 
      static int GRAMMAR_FILE 
      static int LAST_ARG 
      static int PARSE_ERROR 
      static int TOTAL_ARGS 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cyk()
      Constructs a Cyk object and initializes the HashMaps of the variables and the terminals

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Takes a given grammar file as the input and a given string to test against that grammar.
      void processGrammarFile(java.lang.String file)
      Processes the grammar file and builds the HashMap of the list of terminals and variables.
      boolean processString(java.lang.String w)
      Tests the string against the given grammar file using the CYK Algorithm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cyk

        public Cyk()
        Constructs a Cyk object and initializes the HashMaps of the variables and the terminals

    • Method Detail

      • processGrammarFile

        public void processGrammarFile(java.lang.String file)
        Processes the grammar file and builds the HashMap of the list of terminals and variables. Uses the Scanner object to read the grammar file.
        Parameters:
        file - the string representing the path of the grammar file

      • processString

        public boolean processString(java.lang.String w)
        Tests the string against the given grammar file using the CYK Algorithm. In the current version, warnings about type safety, are suppressed
        Parameters:
        w - the input string to test
        Returns:
        true if string w is accepted by the grammar, false otherwise.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Takes a given grammar file as the input and a given string to test against that grammar.
        Parameters:
        args - the list of the given command-line arguments consisting of the grammar file and the string to test, strictly in that order.
